message.entry: The block outputs noise-corrupted GPS measurements based on the input position and velocity in the local coordinated frame or geodetic frame. The block uses WGS84 earth model to convert local coordinates to latitude-longitude-altitude coordinates.

To change the noise levels present in the system, vary the horizontal position, vertical position, and velocity accuracies. Accuracy is the standard deviation of the noise. Specify the decay factor as a scalar in the range [0,1]. To model the global position with white noise, set decay factor to 0. For random walk noise, set decay factor to 1.
The Position and Velocity input ports are N-by-3 matrices. The LLA and Velocity output ports are N-by-3 matrices. The Groundspeed and Course are N-by-1 vectors. Course angle is measured in degrees.
